N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2605.10 - General program requirements

State Regulations
(a) Recipients shall ensure that all eligible
projects that receive assistance from the fund effectively protect the quality
of the water supply, employ good management practices, and fulfill all
applicable requirements, if any, of the following: Federal and State laws, regulations, and executive orders, including, without limitation, prevailing
wage requirements under article 8 of the Labor Law, requirements of the General

Municipal Law and the State Finance Law governing disqualification of bidders, all requirements of the PFLA, and all applicable instructions issued by the
corporation to ensure that these requirements are met. The corporation shall
not provide assistance from the fund unless such requirements are
met. (b) The corporation, DEC and/or
DOH may conduct such reviews, inspections and investigations as they determine
necessary to ensure that applicable Federal, State and local requirements are
fulfilled, and that the terms, requirements, and conditions of the PFLA are
being met. (c) The recipient shall
certify to the corporation that project requirements have been met where such
certifications are permitted by State laws or regulations. (d) The recipient shall have or shall acquire
such title, estate or interest in the site of the eligible project, including, without limitation, necessary easements and rights-of-way, to ensure the
undisturbed use and possession during construction of the eligible project and
for the estimated operational life thereof. (e) The recipient, all authorized
representatives of the recipient, and all contractors and subcontractors
providing services for the eligible project shall comply with all Federal, State and local laws, rules, regulations, and executive orders applicable to
the eligible project, including, without limitation, laws, rules, regulations, and executive orders regarding affirmative action, equal employment
opportunity, and small, minority and women's business enterprises. (f) The recipient is solely responsible for
the preparation of engineering reports, design drawings, plans and
specifications, contract documents, and the inspection of eligible project
construction necessary for the completion of the eligible project. Notwithstanding any review or approval of engineering reports, design drawings, plans and specifications, contract documents, change orders, and/or the
inspection of eligible project construction by the corporation, its employees, agents or representatives, are not responsible for increased costs resulting
from defective engineering reports, design drawings, plans and specifications, change orders, or negligent inspection of project
construction. Notes
